intro: Neckia malayana f. major, commonly known as the Malay neckia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in cymes, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in greenhouses and as a houseplant.
